casebody.data:
In the Matter of the Application of Robert Herman YEARWOOD on Behalf of Stanley Yearwood, an Alien, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus, Petitioner-Appellant, v. Benjamin M. DAY, Commissioner of Immigration at the Port of New York, Respondent-Appellee. Circuit Court of Appeals, Second Circuit. January 20, 1928. No. 230. Samuel Robert Weltz, of New York City, for appellant. Charles H. Tuttle, U. S. Atty., of New York City (Abbot Low Moffat, Asst. U. S. Atty., of New York City, of counsel), for appellee. .

Before MANTON, L. HAND, and AUGUSTUS N. HAND, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

Order affirmed.
